page.title: 17A LOCAL WALK
page.content: Walking around Stockland and Membury,when choosing footpaths to follow,lots of different things can be seen.Wild flowers growing around and about. Hearing the sounds of water splishing and splashing, hearing the birds singing in the treetops. The trees blowing above you,the grass wet with the morning dew.Some fields where the grass is short, some long, where the corn is growing.Gates which can be opened,gates which have to be climbed, passing through farms, walking across roads where wild strawberries grow on the hedges.Walking down rough, bumpy, dusty tracks - the dust flying up making you cough. When walking down the track be careful of the stones jutting up. Daphne Spiller,11.
